title: Add `go install` instructions
description: Add instructions to the README.md for using thicket with `go install`.

title: Add unblocked tickets query
description: Add a way to list tickets that are not blocked by other open tickets. This shows actionable work items. Depends on ticket dependencies feature (TH-9f9dc8).

title: Add --json output flag
description: Add a --json flag to all commands for machine-readable output. This enables integration with other agentic tools.

title: Show status indicator when TUI auto-refreshes from external changes
Need icebox status
description: We should be able to move a bug to the icebox status. Bugs with icebox status have not been fixed but we also do not plan to implement them. Update the documentation to reflect this new bug status

title: Clarify in instructions in AGENTS.md about manual testing
description: An agent mistakenly used the thicket command in the current project to manually test some new command line arguments. Instead, the agent should have created a test instance of Thicket for manual testing. AGENTS.md says not to use the production .thicket directory for manual testing, but we need to update the documentation to be clearer that the agent also cannot use the thicket command in the main project directory for manual testing.

title: Show labels in list table output
description: The 'thicket list' command currently shows ID, PRI, STATUS, and TITLE in table format. Consider adding a LABELS column to show labels in the table view (possibly truncated if too long).

title: Color-code priority in CLI output
description: Use ANSI colors to highlight ticket priority in 'show' and table outputs (e.g., Red for P1, Yellow for P2) to make high-priority items stand out.

title: Comments not correctly persisted to tickets.jsonl
description: When the comments are persisted from SQLite to tickets.jsonl, the data in the comments is lost. Also should check that dependencies are correctly persisted. Add some tests for round-trips between SQLite and tickets.jsonl

title: Add issue type field
description: Categorize tickets by type: bug, feature, task, etc.

title: Add labels support
description: Allow associating short text labels with tickets for grouping. Labels should be stored with tickets in the JSONL file.

title: Add tests for TUI package
description: The internal/tui package currently has no tests. Add unit tests for the list, detail, and form models to verify navigation, filtering, and state transitions work correctly.

title: Update documentation for issue type field
description: Update CLI.md and README.md with the new --type flag, interactive prompt, and show command output.

title: Add THICKET_JSON environment variable support
description: Support a THICKET_JSON environment variable as an alternative to the --json flag. If THICKET_JSON=1 (or true), the CLI should default to JSON output unless overridden by a flag or specific command needs. This follows the pattern established with THICKET_DIR in TH-f7a300.

title: Add interactive mode for humans
description: The add command should have an interactive mode that prompts for the title and other fields for use by humans.

title: Add labels command to list all labels in use
description: Add a 'thicket labels' command that lists all labels currently in use across all tickets, with counts. This helps users discover what labels exist and maintain consistency.

title: Search history in TUI
description: Maintain a history of search queries in the TUI and allow navigating through them using Up/Down keys when the search input is focused.

title: Manage ticket links in TUI
description: Allow users to add or remove 'blocks' and 'blocked-by' relationships between tickets directly from the TUI detail or edit views.

title: Switch to alphanumeric identifiers
description: Rather than using hex strings for the random part of ticket ids, we should use all the alphanumeric characters [a-z0-9] to pack more randomness into the same six characters

title: Add comments support
description: Allow adding comments to tickets. Comments should be stored as separate lines in tickets.jsonl linked by ticket ID. See docs/overview.md for details.

title: Add instructions for making a CLAUDE.md file
description: We need to document how people using thicket should setup their CLAUDE.md file to use thicket. The instructions should be minimal and mostly refer to the quickstart command.

title: Add ticket dependencies
description: Track blocking relationships between tickets. Include 'blocked-by' and 'created-from' relationship types. Must prevent circular blocking dependencies.

title: Show assignee in the list table output
Add assignee field
description: Track who is working on each ticket. Simple text field for the assignee name.

title: TUI header should reflect active filter state
description: When the list is filtered (e.g., to open tickets only), the header shows 'X tickets (Y open)' which is redundant when filtered to open. The header should be clearer about what's being displayed, e.g., '10 open tickets' when filtered to open vs '15 tickets (10 open)' when showing all.

title: Add --data-dir flag to specify custom .thicket directory
description: Add a global --data-dir flag (or similar) to all commands that allows specifying an alternative .thicket directory location. This enables manual testing without affecting the production ticket data. Example: ./thicket --data-dir /tmp/test-thicket list

title: Update agent documentation to instruct agent to add tickets for follow on work when completing an existing ticket.
description: When adding the --interactive flag, the agent did not update the documentation, which is an oversight. Ideally the agent would update the documentation in the same change as implementing the feature, but if the agent is not going to do that, we can at least have the agent file followup tickets for the remaining work. These tickets should be linked to the current ticket because they were discovered when working on that ticket."

title: Adding a comment doesn't appear right away
description: When I add a comment to an issue in the TUI, I don't see the comment in the detail view immediately. However, if I go the list view and then return to the detail view for the ticket, the comment is visible.

title: Sort tickets.jsonl by ID
description: When the tool writes to the tickets.jsonl file, we should store the data in the file sorted by ticket id. The ticket ids are random, which means we'll get fewer merge conflicts with independent edits to the data file.

title: Enumerate top-level tasks for creating webui
description: See parent ticket for project overview. This ticket is about breaking down the webui epic into blocking bugs for each top-level task. Each of those  top-level tasks will need further refinement into actionable bugs.

title: Search highlighting in TUI
description: When filtering by search query in the TUI, highlight the matching substrings in the title and description to make results more visible.

title: Add --label filter to ready command
description: The ready command shows open tickets not blocked by other open tickets. It would be useful to filter these by label, e.g., 'thicket ready --label bug' to see only ready bug tickets.

title: Update documentation for humans to describe the --interactive flag
Update README.md to tell humans about the TUI
description: Humans should mostly use the tui command. The README.md should present that interface as the main interface and only show the most important parts of the CLI interface, referring to docs/CLI.md for the full reference.

title: webui for humans
description: We should have a web-based user interface for humans to interact with the tickets. We should add a command that starts a local web server and then opens that page in the user's browser. The web interface should be able to do anything that the command line interface can do.

title: Add THICKET_DIR environment variable support
description: Support a THICKET_DIR environment variable as an alternative to the --data-dir flag for specifying a custom .thicket directory location. The flag should take precedence over the environment variable. Example: THICKET_DIR=/tmp/test-thicket ./thicket list

title: Comments should have authors
description: Comments should remember who wrote them. The comment command should have a flag to specify the author. Agent instructions should instruct the agent to identify itself when making comments.

title: Document assignee field
Add labels prompt in interactive mode
description: When using 'thicket add --interactive', there's no prompt for labels. Add an optional labels prompt that accepts comma-separated values.

title: Add user-friendly error message for invalid ticket type
description: Add an InvalidType function to internal/errors that lists valid types (bug, feature, task, epic, cleanup), and update add/update commands to catch ticket.ErrInvalidType and return this user-friendly error. Follow the pattern used by InvalidStatus.

title: Investigate unified prompt component for TUI
description: The confirmation prompt for closing tickets was implemented ad-hoc in list and detail views. As more confirmation or input prompts are added, we should investigate creating a unified prompt component or helper.

title: Use relative timestamps in CLI output
description: The show and list commands currently use absolute timestamps (RFC3339). Using relative timestamps (e.g., '2 hours ago', 'yesterday') would make the CLI output more readable.

title: Move commands to separate files
description: commands.go is growing to be quite large. We should refactor the code to put each command in its own file.

title: Highlight search matches in labels
description: The search currently filters by comments, title, and description, but highlighting should also apply to labels in both the list and detail views if they match the query.

title: Edit ticket in TUI should be able to change status
Add a terminal UI for humans
description: Add a terminal user interface for humans to let them interact with the tickets. The user interface should be based on the bubbletea framework (https://github.com/charmbracelet/bubbletea). The first iteration of the terminal UI should show the list of tickets with options to filter on the same properties that can be filtered on the command line. The terminal UI should let the user create, edit and close tickets.

title: Add --assignee filter to ready and list commands
description: Filter tickets by assignee to see only tickets assigned to a specific person.

title: Selected ticket in list view should remain when updating priority
description: In the list view, when you use the keyboard shortcuts to increase or decrease the priority of a ticket, the ticket changes positions in the list, which means the currently selected ticket. Instead, the current ticket should stay selected.

title: Move reference material out of README.md
description: We should streamline the README.md file to contain just the core information about the Thicket project and how to get started using the tool. The detailed reference information for the command line interface should be moved to a separate Markdown file and linked from the README.md file.

title: Ensure agent files tickets for followon work
description: When the agent closes the current ticket the agent is working on, we want the agent to file tickets for additional work. Currently, the agent forgets to do this step. I have had success manually prompting the agent with "Think about what additional work should be done and then file tickets for that work." We should figure out a way to get the agent to do that without manual prompting.

title: Color-code status in CLI output
description: The status of a ticket (open/closed) should be color-coded in CLI output (e.g., green for open, red for closed) to make it easier to scan.

title: TUI should update when the ticket database changes
description: When the TUI is showing the list view and someone else adds or otherwise modifies the ticket database, the TUI should update to show the latest list

title: Add --all flag to ready command to show all ready tickets
description: The ready command now shows only the highest priority ticket. Some users may want to see the full list of ready tickets. Add an --all flag that restores the previous list behavior while keeping the single ticket as the default.

title: Use selection list for status, type, and priority in TUI form
description: Currently status, type, and priority are text inputs that require manual typing and validation. Switching to a selection list or toggle would improve UX and prevent invalid inputs.

title: Split commands_test.go into separate files
description: Currently commands_test.go is very large (800 lines). We should split it into separate files for each command (e.g., add_test.go, list_test.go, etc.) to match the structure of the command implementations.

title: Add type validation to ticket package
description: Implement ValidateType function and use it in ticket.New and ticket.Update to ensure only recognized types (bug, feature, task) are used by default.

title: Add missing fields to show command output
description: The show command is missing various fields, including type, assignee, and labels. Add that information to the ticket details.

title: Color-code ticket types in CLI output
description: Use ANSI colors to distinguish ticket types in 'show' and table outputs (e.g., Red for bug, Green for feature).

title: Highlight search matches in TUI
description: Highlight matching text in title, description, and comments when searching in the TUI to improve discoverability.

title: Add tui command to CLI.md
Add question mark keyboard shortcut for showing help screen
description:
The help screen should explain all the keyboard shortcuts for whichever screen is currently visible.

We should trim down the list of shorcuts displayed at the bottom of the screen to just the commonly used shortcuts and put the rest in the help for that screen.

title: Add search functionality to TUI
description: Add a '/' keybinding to the TUI list view that allows users to filter the list by title or description string.

title: Add advanced filtering to TUI
description: The TUI currently supports filtering by status (open/closed/all). Add support for filtering by type, priority, label, and assignee to match CLI capabilities.

title: TUI form for description should be multiline
description: We need more space for editing the description field. Currently, that field is a single line edit control. We should use a multiline edit control

title: Add unit tests for internal/tui
description: The test coverage for internal/tui is currently at 2.9%. We should add more unit tests to ensure the TUI components work correctly.

title: Escape key in new ticket (and edit ticket) makes it too easy to lose work
description: When the human is creating or editing a ticket in the TUI, pressing the escape key discards the current work. We should add a confirmation dialog to help the user avoid losing work.

title: Add flag to specify link relationships when adding a ticket
description: We should be able to create blocks and created-from links when adding a ticket (without requiring a followup command).

title: TUI should default to only showing open tickets
description: Currently, the TUI defaults to showing all tickets, but I usually don't care about the closed tickets. Initialize the list view filtered on open tickets.

title: Adding a second comment shows the previous comment
description: When I add a comment to one ticket and then start to add a comment to another ticket, the textarea for the second comment is prepopulated with the text from the first comment. Instead, I should get an empty textarea to start with.

title: ready command should just show one ticket and should show the details for that ticket
description: Instead of having the agent run the ready command and then run the show command, we should simplify the workflow to just have the ready command show the details for the highest priority, unblocked ticket. Update all documentation and workflows, including AGENTS.md, to reflect this new, simplier workflow.

title: Add unit tests for internal/tui
description: The test coverage for  is currently at 2.9%. We should add more unit tests to ensure the TUI components work correctly.

title: Expose sort options in TUI list view
description: The TUI list view uses a hardcoded sort order (Priority ASC, Created ASC). Exposing different sort options (e.g., Updated, Title, ID) via keyboard shortcuts would improve navigation.

title: Search comments in TUI
description: Extend TUI search functionality to search within ticket comments in addition to title and description.

title: Centralize global flag definitions
description: Currently, global flags like --data-dir and --json are defined in both cmd/thicket/main.go and internal/commands/commands.go (newFlagSet). This duplication is fragile. We should centralize the definition and parsing of global flags, perhaps in internal/config or a dedicated package, so that all commands and main.go share the same source of truth for these flags.

title: Unify empty field placeholders across CLI commands
description: Currently, different commands use different placeholders for empty fields (e.g., '-' in tables vs '(unassigned)' in details). We should unify these or use a consistent pattern across the CLI for better UX.

title: Detail view should refresh when viewed ticket changes externally
Add priority keyboard shortcuts to detail view
description: The priority shortcuts (+/-) work in the list view but not in the detail view. They should be added to the detail view for consistency.

title: Remove docs/overview.md and any references from the docs
description: This file was created early on in the project and is no longer needed. Before deleting the file, ensure that any information that is still relevant to either users of Thicket or to agents is documented in the appropriate locations.

title: TUI keyboard shortcut for assigning an issue type
description: I should be able to assign common issue types (e.g., bug, task, feature, epic) from the list view

title: TUI keyboard command for adjusting priority
description: In the list view, I need a keyboard shortcut for increasing and decreasing the priority of a ticket

title: Switch the priority keyboard shortcuts around
description: In the TUI, we have + and - change the priority of a ticket. The + (and =) shortcut should make the ticket more urgent, which means changing the priority value to a lower number, and - (and _) should do the inverse.

title: list --status ready should recommend the ready command
description: The agent ran the following command by mistake "thicket list --status ready". We should recognize that mistake and print an error suggesting the user run "thicket ready" instead.

title: Search labels in TUI
description: Extend TUI search functionality to also filter tickets by labels.

title: Enhance 'ready' command with explanation
description: Modify 'thicket ready' to display a brief explanation of why the specific ticket was chosen (e.g., 'Highest priority ticket with all blockers resolved').

title: Add confirmation prompt for closing tickets in TUI list view
description: Currently, pressing 'c' in the list view closes a ticket immediately. It should show a confirmation prompt to prevent accidental closings, similar to how other destructive actions might work.

title: Show issue type in list table output
Add version command
description: Implement aversion command or --version flag to display the current version of Thicket.

title: Add --type filter to list and ready commands
description: Allow users to filter output by ticket type, e.g., 'thicket list --type bug'.

title: Add 'thicket labels' command
description: Implement a new command that lists all unique labels currently used in the project, helping users discover existing tags.

title: Detail view does not update after changing priority
description: When using the keyboard shortcut to change priority in the detail view, the screen does not update to show the new priority. We had a similar bug when adding comments. Consider refactoring the code so that we do not have similar bugs in the future.

title: Maintain selection when changing filters in TUI
description: The TUI list view currently resets the cursor to 0 when switching status filters (e.g., from 'Open' to 'All'). If the previously selected ticket is still present in the new filtered list, the selection should be maintained.

content: Added keyboard shortcuts (b/f/t/E/C) to assign ticket types directly from the list view.

Fixed bug where the comment textarea was prepopulated with text from a previous comment session. Added a Reset() call to the comment input in SetTicketID to ensure a fresh buffer whenever viewing a different ticket.
--message
I don't think this feature is necessary.

Updated internal/tui/tui.go to trigger a detail view reload (if active) upon receiving a FileChangedMsg. Also added reloads for TicketPriorityUpdatedMsg, TicketTypeUpdatedMsg, and CommentSavedMsg to ensure the detail view stays in sync with internal changes.
Starting work: modifying ready command to show only the highest priority unblocked ticket with full details
Implemented selection maintenance in ListModel.Update when TicketsLoadedMsg is received. Now it remembers the selected ticket ID and restores the cursor to its new position after filtering/sorting.
We should update the documentation, including the quickstart command, to recommend using this new command to determine what to work on next.
Implemented assignee field: added Assignee field to Ticket struct, --assignee flag to add/update commands, storage layer support, and display in show output.

- Currently ErrInvalidType just says "invalid ticket type"
- Should follow the pattern of InvalidStatus which lists valid options
- The add/update commands should catch the error and provide a helpful hint listing valid types (bug, feature, task, epic, cleanup)
Added a confirmation prompt when discarding changes in the create/edit ticket form. The prompt only appears if changes have been made to the form fields.
Starting work. Will explore adding a reminder/prompt to the close command to encourage filing follow-on tickets.
Starting work: Adding Labels field to Ticket struct, updating storage, and adding CLI support for --label flags
Decided not to add this data to this view.

Implemented comment searching in TUI by loading all comments and filtering tickets if any of their comments match the search query. Updated TicketsLoadedMsg and Store to support fetching all comments.
Implemented: ready command now shows single highest priority ticket with full details. Updated AGENTS.md, README.md, CLI.md, quickstart, and help text.
Completed: Added Labels field to tickets, storage support, and CLI flags (--label for add, --add-label/--remove-label for update, --label for list). Updated CLI documentation.
Job well done.
Refactored internal/commands/commands.go into separate files for each command.
Implemented multiline description field using bubbles/textarea. Updated FormModel to handle textarea with proper sizing and focus.
Added a status message 'Refreshed from disk' in internal/tui/tui.go when an external file change is detected and successfully synced.
Updated AGENTS.md to instruct agents on follow-on work. Also fixed missing documentation for --interactive in README.md as discovered during this task.
The command should be called  and should be limited to open tickets and show the tickets in priority order.
We should also use relative timeouts in the TUI.
Implemented the unblocked command and updated documentation.

Fixed bug where new comments didn't appear immediately in the detail view. Added handling for CommentSavedMsg in DetailModel to trigger a reload of ticket details after a comment is successfully saved.
Updated docs/CLI.md and internal/commands/tui.go to include missing keybindings for Top/Bottom navigation, Priority adjustment, and alternative navigation keys.

Implemented priority adjustment keyboard shortcuts: '+' (or '=') increases priority number (lower priority), '-' (or '_') decreases priority number (higher priority). Added handlers in list view with status message feedback.
By default, the ready command should not show tickets that are assigned to someone.

Swapped priority keyboard shortcuts: +/= now decreases the priority value (making it more urgent/higher priority), and -/_ increases it (making it less urgent/lower priority). Updated help text accordingly.

Implementation complete. Added a 'hint' field to SuccessResponse and modified the close command to show a reminder about filing follow-on tickets. The hint appears in both JSON and plain text output, prompting agents to consider bugs, tasks, or improvements discovered while working.

Implemented lexicographical sorting by ID for tickets, comments, and dependencies in JSONL storage. This ensures that the tickets.jsonl file remains consistent and reduces merge conflicts. Also updated Append operations to maintain this sorted state by always performing a sorted rewrite.
Added 'icebox' status to the ticket model. Updated documentation (README.md, docs/CLI.md) and the TUI to support filtering by icebox status using the 'i' key.

Implemented TUI with bubbletea framework. Features: list view with filtering (open/closed/all), detail view with comments and blockers, create/edit form with field navigation. Key bindings: j/k navigation, Enter to view, n/e/c for new/edit/close, Tab for form navigation, Ctrl+S to save.

Implemented search match highlighting in the TUI. Added highlightMatches utility to styles.go using a new highlightStyle (yellow background, black text). Matches are now highlighted in the ticket list title, and in the detail view's title, description, and comments.
Starting work: exploring list command implementation
Implemented confirmation prompts for closing tickets in both the TUI list view and detail view. Added 'y/n' confirmation handling and styled prompts.
The detail view should also show the related tickets and let the user switch to viewing those tickets.
Implemented priority keyboard shortcuts (+/-) in the detail view and updated help text for consistency with the list view.
Implemented the ability to change ticket status in the TUI form. Added a 'Status' field to the ticket edit/create form and updated the logic to validate and save the new status.
